alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Dyer; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:23PM CST until March 06 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls For the South Fork Forked Deer River...including Jackson, Halls... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of the Forked Deer near Halls. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water is flowing over Highway 210 north of Halls. Several low-lying roads near the South Fork of the Forked Deer River are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Thursday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Sunday morning and continue falling to 0.4 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
